revised_title: The Sanguiferous System in Terebratula and Certain Brachiopoda
tldr: The author investigates the sanguiferous system in Terebratula and certain other Brachiopoda, discovering that the membrane lining the perforations in the shell is an extension of the mantle. The author also suggests that the cells within the caeca are blood corpuscles and that the sinus-system is responsible for aeration of the blood.
